name: unadaptable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able or willing to change or be changed in order to suit different conditions : He was a Southern gentleman and that made him unadaptable to life in the hustling Midwest.
(of an artistic work) not able to be changed into a different form: Long thought unadaptable, Mervyn Peake's fantastical tale finally makes it to the small screen.
More examplesFewer examplesI believe he's a dying breed and, like all unadaptable life forms, will become extinct.I couldn't understand why people were so unadaptable and stuck in their ways.Charlotte Jones adapted Wilkie Collins's "unadaptable" novel The Woman in White. There would be the temptation to make the movie an adaptation of the novel, and the novel is unadaptable.
